name: Viashino Heretic
text: {1}{R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. Viashino Heretic deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to the artifact's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: "The past is buried for good reason."

name: Viashino Outrider
text: Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

editions.flavor: "Give thy ration to thy mount, if the road be long. So sayeth the bey."

name: Viashino Racketeer
text: When Viashino Racketeer enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "You may call me a fool, selling this stuff on Orzhov turf. Well, you need to be a little reckless to survive."

name: Viashino Runner
text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"It moved this way, an' that way, an' then before I could stick it, it jumped over my head an' was gone."
—Jula, goblin raider

"It moved this way, an' that way, an' then before I could stick it, it jumped over my head an' was gone."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Viashino Sandscout
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandscout to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

editions.flavor: A viashino's overlapping scales form a buffer against Shiv's ash-flecked winds and a slippery target for goblin pikes.

name: Viashino Sandstalker
text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

editions.flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

"Some believe Sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

name: Viashino Sandswimmer
text: {R}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Viashino Sandswimmer to its owner's hand. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Viashino Sandswimmer.

editions.flavor: Few swim in a place of such thirst.

name: Viashino Shanktail
text:
First strike
Bloodrush — {2}{R}, Discard Viashino Shanktail: Target attacking creature gets +3/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Slizt Clan's battle cry is an impressive display of fury, defiance, and spit.

name: Viashino Skeleton
text: {1}{B}, Discard a card: Regenerate Viashino Skeleton.

editions.flavor: Underneath the Dregscape lay the remains of creatures long extinct from Grixis.

name: Viashino Slasher
text: {R}: Viashino Slasher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Citizens of Ravnica stick to the main streets. Shortcuts may look tempting, but down each alley, dozens of hungry hands await, and screams do not carry into the busy market throng.

name: Viashino Slaughtermaster
text:
Double strike
{B}{G}: Viashino Slaughtermaster gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: "I'll fight two at once, and then lick their guts from my blades."
"I'll fight two at once, and then lick their guts from my blades."

name: Viashino Spearhunter
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.

"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

name: Viashino Weaponsmith
text: Whenever Viashino Weaponsmith becomes blocked by a creature, Viashino Weaponsmith gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Within the rig settlement, those who have mastered the making of weapons earn highest honor.

name: Viashivan Dragon
text:
Flying
{R}: Viashivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Viashivan Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.

name: Vibrating Sphere
text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get -0/-2.

editions.flavor:
"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Vicious Betrayal
text:
As an additional cost to cast Vicious Betrayal, sacrifice any number of creatures.
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature sacrificed this way.

name: Vicious Hunger
text: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.

"Blood is foul, the flesh dross. My ascendance thirsts for life itself."
—Crovax
Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.
Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.

name: Vicious Kavu
text: Whenever Vicious Kavu attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: As battle raged in Shiv, a strange new ally appeared from below the ravaged ground.

name: Vicious Shadows
text: Whenever a creature dies, you may have Vicious Shadows deal damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Thrashes of the ancient past still linger in spirit and shadow, desperate to sink their claws into our souls."
—Rakka Mar

name: Victimize
text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: The priest cast Xantcha to the ground. "It is defective. We must scrap it."

"Die. But die knowing that your pathetic life will yield a great bounty for me."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

—Zul Ashur, lich lord

editions.flavor:

name: Victorious Destruction
text: Destroy target artifact or land. Its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"The refugees look at these structures with hope. We must relieve them of this burden."
—Juex, tormentor exarch

name: Victory
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

name: Victory's Herald
text:
Flying
Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.
The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.

name: Victual Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."

editions.flavor: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."

name: View from Above
text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. If you control a white permanent, return View from Above to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "This air feels so heavy and thick. There are no winds to speak of. I fear the knowledge that comes from a place like this."

name: Vigean Graftmage
text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{U}: Untap target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Vigean Hydropon
text:
Graft 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
Vigean Hydropon can't attack or block.

editions.flavor: Fruits of magic, roots in science.

name: Vigean Intuition
text: Choose a card type, then reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)

name: Vigilance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

editions.flavor:
"Put a spear in a peasant's hands, and you have an expendable troop. Put a purpose in his heart, and you win a warrior."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

name: Vigilant Drake
text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.

editions.flavor: It can stay aloft for weeks with little or no sleep.
Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.
Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.

name: Vigilante Justice
text: Whenever a Human enters the battlefield under your control, Vigilante Justice deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: It begins as a whisper and ends with the red roar of fire.

name: Vigilant Martyr
text:
Sacrifice Vigilant Martyr: Regenerate target creature.
{W}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Vigilant Martyr: Counter target spell that targets an enchantment.

name: Vigilant Sentry
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Vigilant Sentry gets +1/+1 and has "{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn."

name: Vigil for the Lost
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you may pay {X}. If you do, you gain X life.

editions.flavor: "As she grew cold in my arms, I swore an oath that her funeral pyre would be dwarfed by a bonfire of our enemies."

name: Vigor
text:
Trample
If damage would be dealt to a creature you control other than Vigor, prevent that damage. Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Vigor is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

name: Vigor Mortis
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.
After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

name: Vigorous Charge
text:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gains trample until end of turn. Whenever that creature deals combat damage this turn, if Vigorous Charge was kicked, you gain life equal to that damage.

text:
Whenever a Werewolf enters the battlefield under your control, you may transform it.

Trample

text: Whenever a player's skin or fingernail touches Vile Bile, that player loses 2 life.

name: Vile Consumption
text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay 1 life."

editions.flavor: The plague moved faster than an army and was far more deadly.

name: Vile Deacon
text: Whenever Vile Deacon attacks, it gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Clerics on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "The Cabal and the Order really aren't that different. After all, we are both empowered by faith."

name: Vile Rebirth
text: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor:
"‘Here lies our beloved Gartu, the gentlest of all men.' Ooh, I love irony."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
Grave robbers digging down cautiously listen for anything digging up.

name: Vile Redeemer
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Flash

name: Vile Requiem
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Vile Requiem.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Vile Requiem: Destroy up to X target nonblack creatures, where X is the number of verse counters on Vile Requiem. They can't be regenerated.

name: Village Bell-Ringer
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.

editions.flavor: "Priests, hunters, slayers—to arms! The enemy approaches!"

name: Village Cannibals
text: Whenever another Human creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Village Cannibals.

editions.flavor: Some have endured the horrors of Innistrad by becoming the worst monsters of all.

name: Village Elder
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Enchant me with your tale-telling. Tell about Tree, Grass, River, and Wind. / Tell why Truth must fight with Falsehood, and why Truth will always win."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Village Ironsmith
text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.

editions.flavor: Each night, he abandons the trappings of civilization.

name: Village Messenger
text:
Haste
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Messenger.

editions.flavor: "I'm afraid it's bad news."

name: Villagers of Estwald

editions.flavor: You can spot a werewolf-infested town by its lack of butcher shops.

name: Village Survivors
text:
Vigilance
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control have vigilance.

editions.flavor: As their villages fell to werewolves, fleeing refugees discovered they too had remarkable survival instincts.

text:
Villainous Ogre can't block.

editions.flavor:
"The war saw the ogres emerge from their caves, reeking of blood, with the power of oni in their veins."

editions.flavor: Gold buys death. Death earns gold.
Gold buys death. Death earns gold.

name: Vindicate

text: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "We have no sun to guide our dead, so I tend the prismatic flames of the spirit fires that show the souls their way. When I die, I hope there is one left to guide my spirit home."

Enchant artifact

editions.flavor:
"In the midst of horror beyond imagining, I still see things that lift my heart."

name: Viridian Revel

—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Viridian Scout

editions.flavor: They know a hoverguard's only blind spot is directly above it.

name: Viridian Shaman
